extends: Stencil component inheritance and composition testing
description: Comprehensive testing framework for Stencil extends functionality covering lifecycle, decorators, controllers, and edge cases

summary.note: Last updated: November 24, 2025 at 2:42 AM PST

1.description: Lifecycle Inheritance - Component lifecycle events inherited from base class

lifecycleEvents.purpose: Test load lifecycle inheritance with base class event propagation
Test render lifecycle inheritance with base class event propagation
Test update lifecycle inheritance with super() call chains

2.description: Multi-Level Lifecycle Inheritance - Lifecycle events through multi-level inheritance chains

lifecycleEvents.purpose: Test load lifecycle inheritance with multi-level inheritance chains and super() calls
Test render lifecycle inheritance with multi-level inheritance chains and super() calls
Test update lifecycle inheritance with super() call chains

3.description: Property & State Inheritance Basics - Basic @Prop and @State inheritance without conflicts

basicFeatures.description: Base class @Prop properties inherited by component - basic property passing and rendering
Base class @State properties inherited by component - basic reactive state management
Component defines additional @Prop and @State alongside inherited ones - no conflicts
Inherited properties trigger re-renders correctly in component hierarchy

4.description: Method Inheritance Basics - Basic @Method inheritance and super() calls

basicFeatures.description: Base class @Method decorators inherited by component - basic method exposure
Component methods call super() to invoke parent method logic before/after extension
Component overrides base class methods while maintaining @Method decorator behavior
Component combines base class method logic with its own implementation

5.description: Render Method Inheritance - Basic render() inheritance and template composition

basicFeatures.description: Component render() method calls super.render() to include parent template
Component composes parent template with additional content and structure
Parent template slots work correctly when inherited and extended
CSS classes from parent template maintained in component extension

6.description: Abstract Base Class Inheritance - Components extending Stencil-decorated abstract classes

7.description: Component-to-Component Inheritance - Components extending other component classes

8.description: External Library Inheritance - Components extending classes from external Stencil libraries

9.description: Mixin Composition - Components extending via Stencil Mixin function for behavior composition

10.description: Event Handling Inheritance - @Listen decorators and event propagation through inheritance chains

eventFeatures.description: Multiple @Listen decorators at different inheritance levels - event handling order and precedence
How custom events bubble through inheritance chains and component hierarchies
Document and window listeners in base classes vs component-specific listeners
When base class and component define same event handler - which executes and in what order

11.description: Watch Decorator Inheritance - @Watch behavior through inheritance chains and reactive patterns

watchFeatures.description: Multiple @Watch decorators for same property at different inheritance levels
Order of watch handler execution: base class first, component second, or override behavior
Watch handlers triggering other property changes through inheritance hierarchy
When base class and component both watch same property - execution behavior and conflicts

12.description: Controller-Initiated Updates - Base class triggering host component updates (ClockController pattern)

controllerFeatures.description: Base class calls abstract requestUpdate() method - simulates Lit's this.host.requestUpdate()
@State lives on component, not controller - component controls its own state updates
Controller requests updates, doesn't force them - component decides how to respond

13.description: FloatingUI Controller - Real-world reactive controller for Popper.js integration (Bricks components)

controllerFeatures.description: Controller creates and manages Popper class instance in componentDidLoad lifecycle
Provides update()/updateInstance() methods to replace updatePopoverInstance() in host components
Handles popper.destroy() cleanup in disconnectedCallback
Used by bricks-tooltip and bricks-menu-button components from Bricks component library

15.description: Decorator Conflicts & Edge Cases - Testing inheritance chain conflicts and compiler behavior

conflictScenarios.description: Same prop name defined in base class and component - compiler precedence rules
Same state name defined in base class and component - runtime behavior and conflicts
Same method name defined in base class and component - override behavior
Same name used as @Prop in base, @State in component - compiler error handling
Unsupported inheritance scenarios and error conditions
Verify appropriate compiler errors for invalid decorator conflicts

16.description: SSR & Hydration - Server-side rendering and hydration behavior with inheritance chains

ssrFeatures.description: How inheritance chains render on the server - component hierarchy and lifecycle execution
Client-side hydration of server-rendered components with inheritance - state synchronization
Handling differences between server and client rendering of inherited components
Critical for enterprise applications using SSR - ensure inheritance works in production

17.description: ReactiveControllerHost Pattern - Composition-based controllers with automatic lifecycle hooking
17.note: All tests passing. Demonstrates composition over inheritance pattern with automatic lifecycle hooking

controllerFeatures.description: Controllers are automatically called during lifecycle events - no manual super() calls needed for controllers
Controllers are encapsulated and independent - changes to controller don't directly impact component
Uses 'has-a' relationship (composition) rather than 'is-a' relationship (inheritance) for domain logic
Implements ReactiveController interface similar to Lit, but with automatic lifecycle integration

18.description: Inheritance-Based Scaling - Demonstrates how inheritance scales with 3 components and 2 controllers (ValidationController, FocusController)
18.note: Scaling demonstration: 3 components (TextInput, RadioGroup, CheckboxGroup) using 2 controllers via inheritance pattern

controllerFeatures.description: 3 components sharing the same base class with ValidationController and FocusController
Components extend FormFieldBase which extends ValidationControllerBase and composes FocusControllerBase
Both components and controllers tap into lifecycle events (componentDidLoad, disconnectedCallback)
Uses requestUpdate() pattern to trigger re-renders by updating @State properties

19.description: Composition-Based Scaling - Demonstrates how composition scales with 3 components and 2 controllers (ValidationController, FocusController)
19.note: Scaling demonstration: 3 components (TextInput, RadioGroup, CheckboxGroup) using 2 controllers via composition pattern

controllerFeatures.description: 3 components sharing the same controllers via composition
Components extend ReactiveControllerHost and compose ValidationController and FocusController
Controllers' lifecycle methods are called automatically via ReactiveControllerHost - no manual super() calls needed
Controllers are accessed via properties (this.validation, this.focus) providing better encapsulation

12a.description: Direct State Management - Simplified pattern where base class owns @State directly (superior to Lit)
12a.note: All tests passing. Demonstrates superiority of Stencil's direct state inheritance over Lit's ReactiveController pattern

controllerFeatures.description: Base class owns @State directly - no controller.value needed like in Lit
State changes automatically trigger re-renders - no host.requestUpdate() needed
No interface implementation or host reference needed - just extend the base class
Demonstrates Stencil's superior extends functionality compared to Lit's ReactiveController pattern
